pullRequest.title: Introduce responseRoot attribute in exits for openapi schema generation

commit.message: Introduce elementName attribute for openapi schema generation

nodes.bodyText:
I think you should rephrase this a little. Instead of
In case the responseRoot attribute is set in the validator you can write
In case elementName is not set, but the responseRoot attribute is set in the validator

I do agree that the operationId should be based on receiver or listener, and not on adapter, but the name attribute as it is right now is not a nice solution, because it tends to get a name like listener of [Json2XmlValidator-API-POST].
Will this be solved when you extend this exit.elementName solution to the input? Maybe introduce a 'operationId' attribute in ApiListener then.

commit.message: add parameters to open api schema for get method

nodes.bodyText:
This is a lot of text and to me, it's very confusing. The exit does not expect an element?
It specifies the (response root) element to use when you've defined an OutputValidator.

Maybe the / check should be moved to getUriPattern() so you don't have to add a param to the getCleanPattern method?
In getCleanPattern you can then default {*} to a fixed value such as {id}?
Only when the GET method is used? Other http methods can also have parameters?
Please create a new test for every new thing you add.. Right now this single method is testing over 10 different things..

commit.message: change endpoint for each test case
clean up dispatcher after each test case

nodes.bodyText:
The choice of the 'first' or 'last' responseRoot value configured in the validator should be based on exit.state, instead of exit.code.
Please change the IbisDoc to:
Configures the responseRoot in the OpenAPI schema for this exit. If not set, the responseRoot value of the validator will be used. If that contains multiple (comma separated) values, the first will be used for the exits with state 'success', the last for the other exits.
Please use getUriPattern() where you want to use getCleanPattern(false). Then it is not necessaray to add a parameter to getCleanPattern().
No need to assign pattern here
You should not map parameters by name, but by sessionKey
In this case (i.e. when building a configuration) it is more clear to have a separate line for each method

I think the getUriPattern() should always return a usable pattern with or without prepending slash.
That way this 'check' would not be necessarily, and we will have a uniform way to displaying the pattern.
Should this block exist if when it's empty?

nodes.bodyText:
Right now this is a 'hack' so you don't have to change the expected results. On line 39 to 56 you can see the input/output from the setUriPattern(...) and getUriPattern()
In this case, since the method returns a different value the test should reflect this, (and not manipulate the test results).
I think, the getUriPattern() method as well as the getCleanPattern() should be tested, now that you moved some functionality over to other methods.
